PROBLEM STATMENT: 
 
Design a manually controlled mechanical bot, which can push or kick a medium sized plastic ball. 
 
The prime motive of this game is to push or kick the ball in opponent's goalpost and avoid the ball 
 
from going into yours. Confinement of the ball by any sort of mechanism of the bot for more than 
 
10 seconds will be treated as penalty. 
 
-The bot taking less time will be qualified. (Round 1) 
 
-The bot with more goals (point) will win the game. (Knockout and finals). 
 
 NOTE-IF A KNOCKOUT MATCH REMAINS GOAL LESS THEN THE TEAM WHICH TOOK LESS TIME TO 
 
QUALIFY FOR THE KNOCKOUTS WILL GO FOR THE NEXT ROUND.TIME ALLOTED FOR KNOCKOUTS 
 
IS 4 MINUTES 
 
ROUND 1: 
 
It will be a time trial round where the bot needs to score goals by passing some obstacles (defenders) 
 
in minimum time. A number of balls will be there in different parts of the arena and the bot will have 
 
to put all the balls inside the goalpost. 
 
ROUND 2: 
 
Top 32 teams will be selected from the first round on the basis of best timing of round 1 and then one 
 
to one knockout match will be played. Points will be more if the bot can score the goal from the 
 
penalty box. Moving goal keeper will be present in this round (a part of the arena).if the bot can 
 
score without hitting the goalkeeper, then more points!!! 
 
NOTE- THE KNOCKOUT AND THE ROUND OF TOP 16 WILL BE PLAYED ON THE 2ND DAY AND THE 
 
QUARTER FINAL, SEMI FINAL AND THE FINAL ON THE 3RD DAY. 
 
SELECTED TEAMS WILL BE NOTIFIED. THE TEAMS ARE ALSO REQUESTED TO FOLLOW THE 
 
FACEBOOK PAGE FOR THE UPDATES 
 
RULES: 
 
GENERAL RULES: 
 
? The maximum team size is 4. 
 
? They must all be present students of an engineering institution. They may or may not be 
 
from the same institute. 
 
? No participant can be a member of two teams. No two teams can share the same robot. 
 
? The event co-ordinator is free to make any change to the above rules at any time. Any 
 
such change will be duly notified to the participants as and when required. The decision of 
 
the event co-ordinator will be final and binding. 
 
? Participants must carry valid college id proof. 
 
TECHNICAL DETAILS: 
 
? Team members will not be allowed to touch any part of arena, only organizers are allowed 
 
to handle the arena in any situation, the team will be disqualified whose member found 
 
touching arena. 
 
? You are not allowed to make any changes to your bot once the game has started. 
 
? Participants are not allowed to keep anything inside arena other than the bot. power supply 
 
must be outside of the arena. 
 
? The time measured by organizers will be final and used for scoring of the teams. Time 
 
measured by participants is not acceptable for scoring. 
 
? Organizing team will not be responsible for any kind of damage to your bot. 
 
? Any team which is not able to complete the task, whose scoring is done using judging 
 
criteria. 
 
? Organizers decision will be final and binding in case of any dispute. 
 
? All the game play related decisions will be made on spot by the referee for the game. 
 
? In case of violations there can be penalties from penalty spot on referee discretion. 
 
? If a bot becomes immobile it will be disqualified. 
 
??????Damaging the arena will lead to disqualification. 
 
GAME OVERVIEW: 
 
? Game will be played with light plastic or polymer balls with size similar to golf ball. 
 
? Bots can move in any part of the arena. 
 
? In case the bot scores a goal or ball leaves the arena, ball will be awarded to opposing bot. 
 
? The game will then restart from within starting range. 
 
? Only first start will be from centre in which rear edge of both bots should touch the goal line, 
 
till the start of the game. 
 
? Side will be decided by toss.in alternate way it will change. 
 
? Ball start will always be by a bump or kick not by moving or dragging the ball. 
 
? Bot cannot keep the ball on halt for more than 10 seconds by any contact or shielding, 
 
in such a case foul will be awarded and the opponent will start the game from his 
 
starting zone. 
 
? In case of ball halts(more than 10 seconds) which does not involve mistake of any 
 
participant, the game will restart from the nearest ‘PointStart’ marked on the arena 
 
as shown in the arena map. 
 
? Also, both bots will be placed equal distance apart from the 'PointStart. 
 
ROBOT SPECIFICATION: 
 
Specification: 
 
? No bot can measure more than 30*30*25 centimetres in length and breadth however there 
 
is no restriction on how to control bot or how to kick the ball. 
 
? Participants can use any method to hit the ball. Shear bump is as good as a power kick. 
 
ARENA DETAILS: 
 
? Size of goal is 45 centimetres wide and 15 centimetres high. 
 
? Game will be played with light plastic or polymer balls with size similar to golf ball.
